- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/working-groups/): Working Groups What is a Working Group? A working group addresses an unmet need or open question broadly across the US-RSE community. Unlike an affinity group, a working group must have a work product, deliverable, or specific goal, such as a report...

## About
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/about/affinity-groups/): Affinity Groups What is an Affinity Group? An affinity group is a set of people linked by a common interest or purpose. Affinity groups have fewer formal requirements than working groups (next section) and can serve as a bridge to form future...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/about/code-of-conduct/): Code of Conduct This code of conduct is served from USRSE/documents on GitHub. You can make contributions or suggestions for changes there. Code of Conduct Committee The current Code of Conduct Committee consists of: Ludovico Bianchi Suzanne...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/about/contact/): Contact the US-RSE Association To get in contact with the US-RSE Steering Committee , email us at contact@us-rse.org . - [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/about/finances/): US-RSE Financial Status Community Initiatives Project US-RSE is a fiscally sponsored project of Community Initiatives (CI), a 501(c)(3) non-profit organisation based in California, USA.

- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/about/mission/): Mission The US-RSE Association is centered around four main goals. We aim to target our activities and actions to serving these aspects: 1. Community We seek to provide a coherent association of those who identify with the role (not necessarily...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/about/sponsors/): US-RSE Sponsors US-RSE is currently sponsored in large part from a grant by the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation. Individual Sponsors Thank you to our individual sponsors for your generous donations.

- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/about/what-is-an-rse/): What is an RSE? We like an inclusive definition of Research Software Engineers to encompass those who regularly use expertise in programming to advance research.

## Ag
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/ag/dmv-rse/): DMV-RSE Affinity Group Overview DMV (Delaware-Maryland-Virginia) RSE is a regional affinity group for professionals in RSE and RSE-adjacent disciplines.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/ag/neuro-rse/): Neuro-RSE Affinity Group Overview Neuroscience RSE (Neuro-RSE) is an affinity group for those working on research software in neuroscience. We meet to support each other and discuss common issues and concerns.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/ag/r-rse/): R-RSE Affinity Group Overview The R Affinity Group exists to increase the representation of R users in the US-RSE community and provide opportunities for members to develop R skills.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/ag/rg-north-carolina/): North Carolina Regional Group Overview The North Carolina Regional Group connects US-RSE members in North Carolina and organizes local events. Membership The North Carolina Regional Group is US-RSE Regional Group intended to bring together research...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/ag/rg-stl/): St. Louis Metro Regional Group Overview The St. Louis Metro Regional Group connects US-RSE members in the St. Louis Metro region and organizes local events. Membership The St.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/ag/rse-gln/): RSE Group Leaders' Network Overview The RSE Group Leaders‚Äô Network (RSE-GLN) is a group of individuals leading RSE teams who meet to support their peers with the challenges of leading RSE groups.

## Docs
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/docs/details/): Details on how the website works to supplement README.md Advanced Content Questions How do I update the map? The map is generated programmatically from the US-RSE member list by a separate repository https://github.com/USRSE/usrse-map.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/docs/events/): Adding Events Adding Events You can add an event or training to the site by adding a markdown file in the _events folder, organized by year. Events are displayed at https://us-rse.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/docs/feeds/): Feeds Feeds Added in early 2022, we wanted an ability to provide easy ways to automate specific events, or subscribe to them. For the reason, we added pages/feeds which includes: RSS feeds for different kinds of content, and equivalent JSON feeds...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/docs/local_previews/): Working with the repo locally Working with the repo locally Content-only changes can often be done directly on the GitHub website. Changes affecting the function or structure of the site should be previewed fully locally before being submitted via...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/docs/tests_ci/): Automation and Tests Automation and Tests Tests are run during continuous integration to catch any errors and to preview content. Specifically, usrse.github.

## Jobs
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/jobs/2023-community-manager/): US-RSE Community Manager Posted: July 18, 2023 US-RSE is hiring a Community Manager! Community is the first part of the US Research Software Engineer Association‚Äôs ( US-RSE ) mission .
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/jobs/2023-executive-director/): US-RSE Executive Director (Part-Time) Posted: July 18, 2023 US-RSE is hiring an Executive Director! Up to this point in its history, the US-RSE Association has been organized and run solely by volunteers, primarily members of the steering committee.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/jobs/policy/): US-RSE Job Posting Policy We happily post RSE and RSE-related job openings as a service to our community. There is currently no fee associated with posting to the US-RSE job board .

- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/news/page9/): 2023 Steering Committee Candidate Information election Posted on November 10, 2023 Candidates for the 2023 US-RSE Steering Committee election are listed below. Five of these candidates will be elected for a two-year term starting January 2024.

## Resources
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/resources/organizations/): RSE Organizations US-RSE endeavors to connect RSEs to other organizations that may be of benefit. These include organizations that help us to do our work better and organizations that employ groups of RSEs . ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Back to top ‚¨ÜÔ∏è
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/resources/organizations/relevant/): Organizations Relevant to RSEs These organizations can help to improve your knowledge about software engineering, and research practices. Better Scientific Software (BSSw) : A central hub for the community to address challenges in software...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/resources/organizations/rse-groups/): Institutional RSE Groups in the United States This is an incomplete list of RSE groups at US institutions that take on a range of projects and are open to collaborations with researchers within the scope of their support.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/resources/rses/): RSE Resources These resources can be helpful to establish RSE positions, groups, or further understanding of research software engineering. Getting Started with the RSE Movement within your Organization: A Guide for Individuals Research Software...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/resources/training/): Education and Training Resources This page is redirecting you to https://us-rse.org/wg/education_training/training/ . ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Back to top ‚¨ÜÔ∏è

## Wg
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/code-review/): Code Review Overview This working group grew out of a BoF at the US-RSE conference. The original chairs, Jeff Carver and Troy Comi, were two of the panelists in the BoF Discussion.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/community-calls/): Community Calls Overview The Community Calls working group plans monthly virtual meetings to promote community connections and share information on topics of interest to US-RSE members.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/dei/): Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Working Group Overview The US-RSE Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) working group is dedicated to supporting DEI through education, outreach, and more as described in our mission statement .
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/education_training/): Education & Training Working Group Overview The Education & Training working group is for those that are interested in regular discussions about education and training for RSEs.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/education_training/seminar_series/): Education & Training Seminar Series The Education and Training Seminar Series is a series of technical talks and tutorials presented by leading researchers and practitioners in the field of research software engineering.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/education_training/skills/): Skills Used by RSEs The following is a list of skills that an RSE might possess. The US-RSE Education and Training Group maintains and publishes this list in an effort to provide resources to better define RSE roles and to help direct individuals...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/education_training/training/): RSE Training Resources The US-RSE Education & Training Working Group has started an effort to compile a list of useful videos, tutorials, and other training materials well suited for learning Research Software Engineering topics.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/group-management/ag-template/): Template Affinity Group Webpage Overview Put a short overview of your affinity group here. Membership Are there guidelines for membership? Do you have an intended audience? Describe it here.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/group-management/form-a-working-group/): Processes and Requirements for Forming US-RSE Working Groups Overview This document proposes a set of processes and requirements for forming groups within US-RSE. It was produced as part of the first community building workshop.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/group-management/form-an-affinity-group/): Processes and Requirements for Forming US-RSE Affinity Groups Overview This document proposes a set of processes and requirements for forming groups within US-RSE. It was produced as part of the first community building workshop.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/group-management/): Group Management Working Group Overview The US-RSE Group Management Working Group is dedicated to enabling support and conversation between the various US-RSE Affinity and Working Groups.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/group-management/wg-template/): Template Working Group Webpage Overview Put the overview of your Working Group here. This should include: the purpose of the group information on how to join meeting cadence (if applicable) Make sure to change the metadata above to reflect the title...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/mentorship-program/): Mentorship Program Overview The US-RSE Mentorship Program aims to create and sustain an inter-institutional program dedicated to promoting mentorship among research software engineers within US-RSE.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/outreach/): Outreach Working Group Overview This working group is currently looking for new chairs and is INACTIVE until otherwise stated. The US-RSE Outreach Working Group is dedicated to broadening US-RSE‚Äôs engagement with the research software engineer (RSE)...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/rse-empowerment-national-labs/): RSE Empowerment in National Labs Working Group Overview The RSE Empowerment in National Labs working group, conceptualized in 2022, is for those who are interested in working towards the empowerment of RSEs in national labs and other similar...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/rse-gln/): This page is redirecting you to /ag/rse-gln/ . ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Back to top ‚¨ÜÔ∏è
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/testing/): Testing Overview The Testing Working Group aims to bring together RSEs, researchers, and practitioners to discuss current limitations in testing research software, share knowledge, and collectively address cutting-edge challenges, thereby advancing...
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/ux/): User Experience Overview The User Experience Working Group (UXWG) advocates for increased awareness and adoption of user experience (UX) methods in research software engineering.
- [US-RSE | United States Research Software Engineer Association](https://us-rse.org/wg/website/): Website Working Group Overview The website working group was established to work on the website that you are reading right now! To get involved with the website working group, visit the #website channel on the US-RSE slack.
